ContentBrowser.Description: A tool to view, manage, and work with project Assets in Unreal Editor.
Functions: Create, import, organize, view, and manage Assets.
Manage content folders and perform specific Asset operations.
Operations: Find Assets with text and advanced filtering.
Migrate Assets between folders or projects.

Methods: From Window menu in top menu bar.
From Create menu on Main Toolbar.
By clicking Content Drawer button on bottom toolbar.
AccessingContentBrowser.Instances: Open up to four instances simultaneously.
UseCases: Filter different Asset types in different browsers.
AccessingContentBrowser.Docking: Dock along the bottom, re-dock, float as window, or move to Sidebar.

ContentDrawer.Description: Special instance of Content Browser with different behavior.
OpeningMethods: Click Content Drawer button on bottom bar.
Use Ctrl + Space (Windows) or Cmd + Space (macOS) shortcut.
ContentDrawer.Behavior: Automatically minimizes when losing focus, can be docked to stay open.

ContentBrowserTopics.Title: Content Browser Settings Reference
ContentBrowserTopics.Description: Adjust settings like thumbnail display and Asset filtering.

ContentBrowserTopics.Title: Filters and Collections
ContentBrowserTopics.Description: Sort and group Assets using filters and Collections.

ContentBrowserInterface.Description: Describes the Content Browser interface and functionality.

NavigationBar.Description: Controls for working with Assets, navigating folder paths, and breadcrumb trail.

Components.Name: Asset Control Buttons
Functions: Add: Add existing or new Assets.
Import: Open file browser to add Assets.
Save All: Save all unsaved Assets.

Components.Name: History Back and Forward Buttons
Components.Description: Navigate back and forward between recent paths.

Components.Name: Breadcrumb Trail Path
Components.Description: Shows current folder path. Click folders to navigate.

SourcesPanel.Description: List of all folders in your project.

Components.Name: Project Name
Components.Description: Current project name. Click to collapse/expand folders list.

Components.Name: Search Buttons
Components.Description: Open Search bar to filter folders in real time.

Components.Name: Asset Tree
Components.Description: Hierarchical list of folders. Behaves like OS folder trees.

Components.Name: Search Buttons
Components.Description: Open Search bar to filter Collections.

Components.Name: Asset Count
Components.Description: Number of Assets in each Collection.

FiltersColumn.Description: Contains built-in and custom filters. Enable/disable by clicking.

SearchBar.Description: Locate Assets by name and type.

Components.Name: Filters Button
Components.Description: Open Filters menu to customize Asset display.

Components.Name: Save Search Button
Components.Description: Save current search as filter or Collection.

AssetView.Description: Shows available Assets in the selected folder or Collection.

Components.Name: View Area
Components.Description: Shows Assets after applying filters and search criteria.

Components.Name: Asset Count
Components.Description: Number of Assets displayed after filtering.

SettingsButton.Description: Opens Settings menu to adjust view style, filters, content, and search options.

DevelopersFolder.Description: Sandbox environment for developers to duplicate and work on Assets without affecting the main project.
DevelopersFolder.Purpose: Experiment with Asset modifications and project refactors.
DevelopersFolder.SharedProjects: Each developer has a personal folder named after their Windows username, minus invalid characters.
DevelopersFolder.BestPractices: Do not reference Assets from this folder outside of it to avoid cooking errors.

Steps: In the Content Browser, click Settings.
Enable the Show Developer Content option.
In the Content Browser, click the Filters button.
Go to Edit > Project Settings and search for Directories to never cook.
Click Add (+) to add a new item.

SourcesPanelReference.Description: Reference for working with the Sources panel inside the Content Browser.
SourcesPanelReference.Overview: Located on the left side, lists all folders and Collections, customizable for other Asset types.
SourcesPanelReference.Usage: Select folders, collections, or groups to display their contents in the Asset View panel.

Steps: Open Settings menu in the Content Browser.
Enable or disable Show Sources Panel option.
TogglingSourcesPanel.Benefit: Gives more space to work with Assets in the Asset View.

DefaultSources: Hierarchical list of all project folders.

AdditionalSources.HowToAdd: Enable Show Favorites option in Settings menu.
Enable Show C++ Classes option in Settings menu.
Enable Show Developers Content option in Settings menu.
Enable Show Engine Content option in Settings menu.
Enable Show Plugin Content option in Settings menu.
Enable Show Localized Content option in Settings menu.

SourceBasedAssetDisplay.Description: Shows Assets from the selected source, with search and filter capabilities.
SelectionMethods: Shift + Left-click: Select range between start and end.
Ctrl + Left-click: Select or deselect individual folders.

Options.Description: Create a new folder as a child of the selected folder.
Open folder in a new Content Browser window.
Import or create new Assets in the selected folder.
Open the folder in OS file explorer.
Edit the folder name.
Add folder to Favorites.
Set the folder color for organization.
Save all modified Assets in the folder.
Resave all Assets in the folder.
Delete the folder and its contents.
Find and fix redirectors in the folder.
Copy Assets and dependencies to another project.
Show a graph of folder references.
Show an interactive map of memory usage.
Display detailed information about Assets.
Display shader cooking statistics.
Flag Assets with issues.
Connect folder to source control.
Lock folder from edits by others.
Mark folder for addition to source control.
Submit edits and additions, unlocking the folder.
Sync folder to latest version, overriding local changes.
Move folder to new location.
Duplicate folder in the destination.
Duplicate folder and dependencies in the destination.

ContentBrowserSettingsReference.Description: Adjust thumbnail display, Asset filtering, and other areas of the Content Browser.

SettingsButton.Location: Top-right corner of the Content Browser.

ViewType.Description: How Assets in the Asset View are displayed.

Types.Description: List of thumbnails with names and file types.

Operations: Export Asset details as CSV (Columns view only).

Locking.Description: Toggle Lock Content Browser to ignore Find in Content Browser requests.

Options.Description: Show all Assets in a single view. Disable Show Empty Folders to hide empty folders.
Adds Favorites category to the Sources panel if at least one folder or Asset is marked as favorite.
Toggle recursive filtering in Asset View.
Toggle visibility of the All folder in Sources Panel.
Automatically organize folders in Asset view.
Toggle Path View options for large-scale projects.
Toggle visibility of the Sources panel.
Show the Engine C++ Classes folder.
Show the Developers folder.
Show the Engine Content folder.
Show plugin-specific content.
Show localized content.
Choose from Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, Huge.
Adjust thumbnails of 3D Assets by dragging inside the thumbnail.
Render thumbnails in real time.

EditorPreferences.Description: Adjust settings from the Editor Preferences menu.

Settings.Setting: Assets to Load at Once Before Warning
Settings.Description: Max Assets loaded simultaneously before warning.

Settings.Setting: Number of Assets to Keep in Recently Opened Filter
Settings.Description: Assets displayed by the Recently Opened filter.
Render Material instance thumbnails in real time.

FiltersAndCollections.Description: Use filters and Collections to sort and group Assets within the Content Browser.

Differences.Filters: Automatically show/hide Assets, multiple active, saved locally, shared across projects.
Differences.Collections: Manually added references, view one at a time, local or shared with users.

AssetFilters.Description: Narrow down visible Assets based on type or state.

Steps: Click Filters drop-down in Search bar.

CreationSteps: Go to Custom Filter > Create New Filter.
Enter Filter Label, Color, and Filter String.

Methods: Click filter in Filters area to toggle.
Click filter name in drop-down to disable and remove.

Options: Remove: Remove filter from Filters area.
Enable Only This: Disable all others except selected.
Enable All Filters: Enable all filters.
Disable All Filters: Disable all filters.
Remove All Filters: Remove all filters.
Remove All But This: Remove all except selected.

RecentlyOpenedFilter.Description: View 20 most recently opened Assets in a folder.
RecentlyOpenedFilter.Customization: Change number of listed Assets in Editor Preferences.

Collections.Description: Organize sets of Assets into groups, with references only.

Steps: Click Add (+) button in Collections panel.

Methods: Right-click Asset, select Manage Collections, choose Collection.
Select Asset, enable check mark next to Collection.
Right-click Asset, select Manage Collections, uncheck Collection.
Select Asset, disable check mark next to Collection.
RemovingAssets.Warning: Pressing Delete will delete the Asset entirely, not just remove from Collection.

RenamingDeletingCollections.Rename: Right-click Collection, select Rename, enter new name, press Enter.
RenamingDeletingCollections.Delete: Right-click Collection, select Delete, confirm in window.

AdvancedSearchSyntax.Description: Reference for advanced search operators in the Content Browser.
AdvancedSearchSyntax.Usage: Refine searches for content, search for key-value pairs from Asset metadata, and access special key values.

Operators.Description: Tests if value for a key is equal to the specified value.
Tests if value for a key is not equal to the specified value.
Tests if value for a key is less than the specified value (numeric only).
Tests if value for a key is less than or equal to the specified value (numeric only).
Tests if value for a key is greater than the specified value (numeric only).
Tests if value for a key is greater than or equal to the specified value (numeric only).
Returns true if either of two values evaluate to true.
Returns true if both values evaluate to true.
Returns the inverted results of the value that follows it.
Returns the inverted result of a text comparison.

SpecialKeys.Description: Keys available for all Asset types, supporting Equal or NotEqual comparisons.
Keys: Collection: The names of any collections containing the Asset.

Strings.Description: Strings can be quoted or not, with quoted strings allowing spaces and special characters. Use backslashes to escape nested quotes.

AssetMetadata.Description: Metadata is displayed when hovering over an Asset's name. Use metadata to search for Assets.

Basic: Triangles>1500: Search for Assets with more than 1500 triangles.
Type==Blueprint: Search for all Blueprint Assets.
Advanced: (BlendMode==Translucent AND ShadingModel==DefaultLit) OR (MaterialDomain==DeferredDecal AND HasSceneColor==False): Complex search combining multiple conditions.
